intro: Ayenia manzanilloana, commonly known as the Mexican mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at higher elevations. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the spring. Ayenia manzanilloana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
